results.title: [Jeremy James]
results.brief_description:
A Regal Angel fish comes to life from a stamp and gets swallowed whole by a whale. Subsequently the whale is speared and the fish escapes from the whale’s stomach. The fish fears being eaten by another whale he encounters later, but miraculously escapes.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Jazz festival]
results.brief_description: Filmed in 1972 at New York’s Lincoln Center Philharmonic Hall, this all-star swing and jazz festival features such giants as Count Basie and his Orchestra, Ella Fitzgerald, Benny Goodman and the Original Quartet, Duke Ellington and his Orchestra, Gene Krupa, the Dave Brubeck Quartet, Teddy Wilson, Joe Williams and Lionel Hampton. Hosted by the great Doc Severinsen the program includes such wonderful jazz classics as “Lady be good”, “Body and soul”, “Take five”, “It don’t mean a thing” and many more, climaxing with a tribute to the late and great Louis “Satchmo” Armstrong. A unique program by unique jazz talents.

results.title: [Images en negatif]
results.brief_description: An example of the use of negative film material to produce dramatic impact in film. The director, Eugene Deslaw, is one of the pioneers of the avant-garde cinema and in this film he explores the possibilities of negative photography. The result is a poem of imagination and beauty. (Awards: Diploma of Honour: Venice Film Festival, 1956)

results.title: [ILO Webster]
results.creator_credit: John van der Heulen, Bert Kroon and Toonder Studios
results.brief_description: Unless we all work together the great problems of over population and massive unemployment has little chance of being overcome. This animated film discusses the problems and suggests possible ways of tackling them.
